ontology.title: FiCR Ontology
ontology.fullTitle: Fire Compliance and Risk Analysis Ontology
ontology.description: FiCR, Fire Compliance and Risk Analysis, is a domain specific semantic model designed to represent fire safety and fire risk relevant physical objects, building elements, equipment, functional roles, and their relationships in existing buildings.
ontology.purpose: FiCR supports the interoperable description, inspection, and assessment of both fire safety compliance and fire risk in existing buildings. It provides a semantic basis for rule based reasoning, risk informed analysis, and fire oriented digital twin applications across building operation and maintenance.
ontology.scope: FiCR addresses fire safety and fire risk in existing buildings, covering fire relevant physical objects, building elements, equipment, functional roles, performance attributes, and their relationships within the built environment.
targetAudience: Semantic web developers working with building data

modules.name: Core Building Elements
modules.description: Physical building components including walls, floors, roofs, doors, and windows

modules.name: Fire Safety Systems
modules.description: Active and passive fire protection systems and equipment

modules.name: Fire Safety Roles
modules.description: Functional roles for fire safety analysis

modules.name: Compliance and Assessment
modules.description: Workflow for compliance checking and risk assessment
